item.title: Tobias add a quote by John Hodgman
item.description: "Generally speaking, I think it is fair to say that I am a friend to the creatures of the Earth when I am not busy eating them or wearing them." -- John Hodgman

item.title: Tobias add a quote by John Hodgman
item.description: "I have learned that newborn infants roll their eyes around and move their heads and their arms in short jerky spasms. And if you homeschool them, they will stay this way forever." -- John Hodgman

item.title: Tobias add a quote by John Hodgman
item.description: "Stories hold power because they convey the illusion that life has purpose and direction. Where God is absent from the lives of all but the most blessed, the writer, of all people, replaces that ordering principle. Stories make sense when so much around us is senseless, and perhaps what makes them most comforting is that, while life goes on and pain goes on, stories do us the favor of ending." -- John Hodgman

item.title: Tobias add a quote by Byron Katie
item.description: "Life is simple. Everything happens for you, not to you. Everything happens at exactly the right moment, neither too soon nor too late. You don't have to like it... it's just easier if you do." -- Byron Katie

item.title: Tobias add a quote by Byron Katie
item.description: "Don't be careful. You could hurt yourself." -- Byron Katie

item.title: Tobias add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Tobias add a quote by Dan Brown
item.description: "Great minds are always feared by lesser minds." -- Dan Brown

item.title: Tobias add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The Very first moment I beheld him, my heart was irrevocably gone." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Tobias add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Run mad as often as you choose, but do not faint!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Tobias add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The Very first moment I beheld him, my heart was irrevocably gone" -- Jane Austen
